column3: Editing style<ref name="editStyle" group=Note>"Source" means you see and edit the TeX source files. "WYSIWYM" = What You See Is What You Mean  i.e. you see and edit formatted text. WYSIWYG means that see the output file automatically updated during the edit. Note that some PDF viewers (e.g. evince) automatically reload the PDF document when it is updated on the disk. So  any "source" TeX editor can be turned into partial WYSIWYG editor by opening such a reader in an adjacent window.</ref>

column2: Source<ref group="Note">Not a full TeX editor. Only limited to math expressions only.</ref>

column3: Linux (macOS  Windows)<ref group=Note>Support for non-linux systems considered experimental.</ref>

column9: but can be integrated <ref group=Note>Notepad++ can execute Tex viewers</ref>

column1: ShareLaTeX<ref group="Note">Acquired by Overleaf and launched as Overleaf v2.</ref>
